data.title: NiXantphos: A Deprotonatable Ligand for Room-Temperature Palladium-Catalyzed Cross-Couplings of Aryl Chlorides

paragraphs.context: The synthesis conditions and results for various palladium-catalyzed cross-couplings of aryl chlorides using NiXantphos as a ligand were detailed. The ligand NiXantphos was shown to be deprotonatable under the reaction conditions, leading to the formation of a heterobimetallic Pd–NiXantphos catalyst system. This system was found to outperform other ligands in deprotonative cross-coupling processes (DCCP) with aryl chlorides, affording a variety of triarylmethane products.

qas.question: What ligand was used in the palladium-catalyzed cross-couplings of aryl chlorides?
What type of catalyst system did NiXantphos form under the basic reaction conditions?
How did the performance of the Pd–NiXantphos catalyst system compare to other ligands in DCCP with aryl chlorides?
What was the result of using the Pd–NiXantphos catalyst system in DCCP with aryl chlorides?

answers.text: affording a variety of triarylmethane products

qas.question: Is the NiXantphos ligand deprotonatable under the reaction conditions?
What was the impact of deprotonating NiXantphos on the catalyst system?

answers.text: leading to the formation of a heterobimetallic Pd–NiXantphos catalyst system

qas.question: Did the heterobimetallic Pd–NiXantphos catalyst system show superior performance in DCCP compared to mono- and bidentate ligands?
